data.title: Poland
data.meta_description: Die Bayerische Staatsbibliothek (BSB) in München ist die zentrale Landesbibliothek des Freistaates Bayern und eine der bedeutendsten Forschungsbibliotheken in Europa.
data.text:
The Bayerische Staatsbibliothek owns two incunabula printed in Krakow:

Platea, Franciscus de: Opus restitutionum, usurarum et excommunicationum. [Krakow], 1475.

Digital version

Printed version in the OPACplus/BSB catalogue, call number: 2 Inc.c.a. 400

Turrecremata, Johannes de: Expositio super toto psalterio. Krakow, about 1474/77.

Printed version in the OPACplus/BSB catalogue, call number: 2 Inc.s.a. 1177

Incunabula of Matthew of Krakow, the later bishop of Worms, whose printed works were published in Memmingen, among other places, and of whom we do not know conclusively whether he was Polish or German, can likewise be counted among the Polish collection. This is analogously applicable to the incunabula print of the "Missale Cracoviense" printed by Georg Stuchs around 1495. The print was commissioned by Johannes Haller, a citizen of Krakow, with the authorization of the bishop of Krakow and Gniezno (one of the largest bishoprics in Europe at the time), Frederick Jagiellon (Polish: Fryderyk Jagiellończyk), who, in turn, was the son of the Polish king and grand duke of Lithuania, Casimir II (1427 – 1492) and Elizabeth of Austria (1437 – 1505).

Incunabula of Matthew of Krakow in the:

OPACplus/BSB catalogue

Reference works:

The library's East European, Oriental and Asian Reading Room accommodates numerous important reference works.

A number of them, which are also accessible online, have already been mentioned.

East European, Oriental and Asian Reading Room

Among the most important bibliographies there are:

Estreicher, Karol: Bibliografia polska

Subdivided into several periods, very comprehensive and regularly updated

Locations in the East European, Oriental and Asian Reading Room: Hbost/Ea 93 | Hbost/Ea 95 | Hbost/Ea 97

Korbut, Gabriel: Literatura polska od początków do wojny światowej, 2nd enlarged edition. Warszawa, volume 1 (1929) – (1931).

Printed version in the OPACplus/BSB catalogue, location in the East European, Oriental and Asian Reading Room: Hbost/Eu 207-1 and further volumes

Bibliografia literatury polskiej. „Nowy Korbut”. Warszawa, volume 1 (1963) – (18 volumes so far)

Printed version in the OPACplus/BSB catalogue, location in the East European, Oriental and Asian Reading Room: Hbost/Eu 208-1 and further volumes

Bibliografia historii polskiej. Warszawa, 1938/39. (ongoing)

Printed version in the OPACplus/BSB catalogue, location in the East European, Oriental and Asian Reading Room: Hbost/Es 149-1938/39 and further volumes

Printed version in the OPACplus/BSB catalogue, location in the East European, Oriental and Asian Reading Room: Hbost/Ea 9-1 and further volumes

Printed version in the OPACplus/BSB catalogue, location in the East European, Oriental and Asian Reading Room: Hbost/Ea 18-1 and further volumes

Printed version in the OPACplus/BSB catalogue, location in the East European, Oriental and Asian Reading Room: Hbost/Ea 17 s-1 and further volumes

Printed version in the OPACplus/BSB catalogue, location in the East European, Oriental and Asian Reading Room: Hbost/Eu 104 e

To complement the list, two important specialised dictionaries:

Słownik geograficzny Królestwa Polskiego i innych krajów słowiańskich. Warszawa, volume 1 (1880) – 15,2 (1902).

Printed version in the OPACplus/BSB catalogue, location in the East European, Oriental and Asian Reading Room: Hbost/Er 21-1 and further volumes

Printed version in the OPACplus/BSB catalogue, location in the East European, Oriental and Asian Reading Room: Hbost/Ea 215-1 and further volumes
